inn1.comm: Hello! Hello! Tharanga was thinking to leave this one before he realised that the ball was seaming in and he tried to get the bat down in a hurry. The ball whizzed past the edge. It landed on a length outside off and straightened.
lands around leg and moves to middle, pushed out to the on side
on the middle and leg line, defended to the leg side
length delivery straightening around the off stump line, Tharanga leans across to defend to covers
on the middle and off line, hint of inswing, pushed out to mid-off
short of length, cutting away on the middle and off line, squeezed to point region ..
back of length delivery straightening outside off stump, goes for the cut and gets a bottom edge on it
full in length and outside off stump, Dilshan goes for the drive and is beaten..
similar delivery and Dilshan allows this to pass through to the keeper
in the length outside off and Dilshan shoulders arms
on the middle and leg line, tapped to square-leg
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
banged in short and the ball flies through to the keeper
Thwack! He has pulled that straight down the ground! It was the short of length delivery that shaped away outside off, Dilshan rocked back and flat-batted it past the non-striker!
full in length, on the middle, turned wide of mid-on for a single
full in length outside off, Tharanga mistimes his  drive through extra cover
on the middle and leg line, clipped behind square-leg for a single
cut away from the leg and middle line, Tharanga was looking to play it to the on side, nearly got squared-up by the movement but adjusted to stab the ball to point
Loverly! He glided forward and eased it through extra cover. No violence. Pure timing. Just a push.
Violence! This time, it was a length delivery well outside off and Dilshan carved it over cover point
sprays a wide down the leg side
slower one well outside off, Dilshan is unable to reach it
full in length, on the middle, flicked past square-leg
on the off and middle line, defended to the off side
leans across to defend this length delivery to the off
full in length, around the off stump and Dilshan moves forward to drive to mid-off
short in length on the off stump line, punched to covers
Blast! It was a short ball around off and Dilshan pulled it through wide midwicket.
Even better. This short delivery climbed even more and was at the body but Dilshan swiveled nicely to pull it to backward square-leg boundary
You got to like him. What a bundle of entertainment. This time around it was a length delivery outside off and he simply knifed it on the up to point boundary. He square drove on the up
Wallop! Width on offer outside off and Dilshan cashes in. And crashes in. Free swing of the bat and the ball raced away through covers.
leans forward to defend to the off side
this one cuts away from Tharanga who has a lame poke at it.
full in length, cuts away from the middle stump line, and Tharanga edges the defensive poke past the lone slip.  Oram makes a diving stop near the third-man boundary
Shot! It was the short-of-length delivery outside off and Tharanga went back and across to punch it sweetly through point
leans forward to drive to covers
length delivery outside off, Tharanga eases it to backward point. Dilshan will be on strike. here we go.
Fabulicious! A length delivery outside off and Dilshan stays beside the line and crashes it on the up and through extra cover. And the fun continues.
on the middle stump line, on a length, tapped past the non striker
on the middle and leg line, tucked to short fine-leg fielder
on the middle stump line, pushed to mid-on
around the off stump line, pushed out to short extra cover
fullish and just outside off, Dilshan's eyes lit up and he drives hard but again intercepted by the short extra cover
Crash! It was a length delivery well outside off and Tharanga whacks it up and over covers

It was a length delivery on the middle and leg line and Tharanga is struck in the pad, right in front of the stumps, trying to flick it across the line but it's a no ball and so no one shouts out an lbw appeal. Free hit coming up.
backs away and drives but can't beat covers
leans across to defend to the off
just outside off stump, Dilshan late cuts it to right of short third man where Mills makes a tumbling stop and fires in a direct hit at the striker's end (Dilshan was home). Over throws!
full in length on the off and middle line, tapped back to the bowler
moves down the track for the big hit but Tuffey slips in a slower one that deceives him. The keeper collects.
on the off and middle line, punched to covers
on the middle and off line, pushed out to covers. Sri Lanka 51 for 0
slips this down the leg side, Dilshan tries to pull it but couldn't connect
short in length and some width on offer as well but Dilshan couldn't connect properly with his ambitious cut shot
short in length again, cut to left of point where Nathan makes a mess of a regulation stop ..
length delivery in the zone outside off and Dilshan goes his on-the-up drive through covers but no wood on leather. The crowd groan
fuller, on the pads, Dilshan fails to connect with his leg glance and it rolls of the pad
on the pads, turned to short fine-leg region where Oram makes a tumbling save. it was going straight to him, though!
just outside off stump, chops it to point
around the off stump line, punched of the back foot to deep point for a single
Done in by the bouncer. Tharanga was late on the pull and ended up lobbing it to short fine-leg. Dolly of a catch. Tuffey breaks into a smile.
Gorgeous! Sanga leaned forward to caress it straight back down the track, between the lunging bowler and the stumps.
presses back to clip this to fine-leg region
gets forward to push this towards mid-off
leans forward to defend it back down the track. Oram is bowling from round the stumps
tries to turn it to the on side and it strikes the pad
leans forward to tap it to the off side
Sangalicious indeed! He glided forward to punch the length delivery through extra cover. Fab.
on the off stump line, turned to short midwicket
leans forward to drive it back down the track. The keeper is standing up to the stumps.
on the pads, Dilshan is unable to put that one away. Opportunity missed.
on the middle and leg, punched to straightish short midwicket
slower, fuller, on the middle and off, run down to backward point
another slow delivery, floated full, driven down to long-on
on the middle and leg line, turned quietly past square-leg
around the off stump line, from round the stumps, tapped wide of backward point
leans forward to defend to point
gets forward to on drive the length delivery for a single
leans forward to deflect this length delivery to midwicket
gets on the front foot to tap this slower off break to the leg side
fullish, on the middle line, dug out .. and the ball bounds of the bat and  pad
on the off and middle line, driven to long-off
on the middle and off, punched t ocovers
fullish, on driven for a single
stays back to dab this one back to the bowler
on the off stump line, punched of the back foot to covers
turns this toward deep backward square-leg region.
just outside off stump, opens the bat-face to steer it to point
leans forward to play the cover drive
length delivery on the off and middle line, driven back down the track to Oram
short in length outside off stump line, cut away but straight to point
fullish, outside off, square driven for a single

The big fish has been caught. Taken out by Styris. It cut in from the off stump line and kept a touch low. Dilshan crouched and wafted across the line but couldn't get bat on ball.It cut in past the bat , hit the front pad and fell on the stumps.
tries to clip this from the off stump to the on side and edges it to his pad ..
on the off stump line, dabbed behind square-leg this time
on the off stump line, pushed out to covers
around the off stump line, tapped to the off side
And again. He bends that front foot and dabs the ball to point
leans forward to defend the length delivery
around the off stump, line, steered to point
on the middle stump line, turned past square-leg
leans forward to push to mid-on, takes couple of steps down the track before shouting out no
high and harmless bouncer outside off.
leans across to tap the length delivery to the off side
short in length, coming in from round the stumps, defended to covers
slower off cutter around off stump, Mahela gets forward to gently tap it to the off side
floated fuller in length, scooped out towards long-on
short in length around the off stump line, punched to covers.
this time around, Sanga punches it out to sweeper cover
around the off and middle line, nudged to point region
on the middle and leg, Mahela tickles it down to fine-leg region
in the zone outside off stump, Mahela tries to guide the straight ball to third ball but ends up pushing inside the line
goes for a fiercer cut this time but ends up mistiming it. The ball rolls away of the bottom edge
arund the off stump, steered to point
gets forward to work this full-length delivery to the on side
just outside off stump, run down to third man
gets forward to push this slower one to short extra cover
length delivery around the off stump line, tapped back down the track
shuffles across to clip it wide of short midwicket for a quick single. Taylor threw in a dive and stopped it but couldn't prevent them from rotating the strike
on the middle and leg, turned wide of midwicket
Mahela breaks free with a whippy boundary throug midwicket. Not without some risk, though. He flicked uppishly but clear of the diving short midwicket fielder
taps this along the ground past square-leg for a single
leans across to ease this to sweeper cover
slower one from round the stumps, driven to mid-on
another slower one, from round the stumps again, pushed through covers for a single
tries to play the big shot down the ground but ends up dragging it towards mid-on
stays back to tuck this one to short midwicket
almost yorker-length around off, pushed back to the off side of the pitch
full again, deflected to short midwicket by the wristy Mahela
presses back to punch the back-of-length delivery through wide midwicket
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
around the off stump line, steered to backward point
short in length, punched through midwicket for a single
slow yorker. well almost there... pushed out to the off side
gets forward to drive this for a single
leans forward to wrist the off break to square-leg
fetches this from outside off and sweeps it to fine-leg region
moves down the track, picks this from outside off and drags it to long-on
on the off stump line, pushed back to Nathan
gets back to punch this short-of-length delivery to long-on
slower, flighted a lot more, outside off, driven to sweeper cover
flighted outside off stump line, gets across to defend and he is struck outside the off stump
gets forward to work this to short midwicket
And again
just outside off stump, steered past backward point
flighted outside off stump, driven to short extra cover where Taylor makes a tumbling stop
around the off stump line, pushed out to point
leans forward to on drive to long-on
flighted outside off stump, Sanga eases it to long-off
flighted delivery well outside off and Mahela wrists it stylishly to square-leg
on the leg and middle, nurdled around the corner
floated full around off, driven back to Nathan
flicks this to short midwicket
leans forward to drive to long-n
just outside off stump, chopped down to short third man
some bounce on this occasion and Mahela jabs it to the off side
gets well back to punch this past the diving bowler , down to long-on
leans forward to squeeze this to point
floated around the leg stump and Sanga gets down on his knee to unfurl the sweep shot
Thump! Mahela went down on his knee and swung this flighted delivery from outside off to the midwicket boundary!
shuffles across and clips the off break to backward square-leg
on the off and middle line, pushed back to the bowler
flighted around the middle and off line, tapped to short cover

lands this just outside leg and Sanga plays a very fine leg glance. But  drama .. Sanga was looking to turn for the second run and he bumped into Nathan  who had his back to Sanga ... Nathan protests to the umpire.. Sanga too has a few words to say...  The umpires intervene . All under control now.
gets forward to play out this delivery without any drama
short in length around off, stops on Sanga who checks his shot and the ball lobs back down the track
just outside off stump, guided to backward point
fuller, just outside off, inviting a drive and Sanga goes for it but ends up edging through the vacant slip region. the keeper, too, was standing up to the stumps
gets back and across to defend to point
short in length, worked through midwicket
leans forward to defend it back to the bowler
on the middle and leg line, flicked to midwicket
around the leg stump line, tries to play the sweep but doesn't connect ..
moves down the track and pings long-on
quicker, flatter, around off, pushed down to long-on
on the off stump line, steered to short third man
short in length, straightens outside off and Mahela tries to clip it to the on side and is struck on the pad
fullish, outside off stump and Sanga drives towards the straight boundary and the long-off fielder moves across to cut it off

And it's Nathan McCullum, who had that tiff earlier with Sanga, who takes his catch. A very good one too. It was the short of length delivery on the off and middle, perhaps stopped a touch on Sanga who checked his on-side punchy shot. The ball lobs to right of short extra cover where Nathan takes a fine diving catch. And he obviously is pumped-up!
full and straight, defended on the front foot
short in length, on the middle, tucked to midwicket
leans forward to work it wide of midwicket for a single
short and wide, the batsman tries to chase it with a cut but doesn't connect
Thump. Silva leans forward to punch the length delivery uppishly past the non striker.
on the middle stump line, Silva gets the bat in front of the pad to defend
on the middle and leg line, turned past square-leg
stays back to turn this past square-leg
outside the off stump line, steered away for a single
on the middle, gets forward to slowly push it towards short midwicket
on the middle, again the pad comes first, then the bat comes around it and he defends
on the middle and leg line, turned past square-leg for a single
slips this one to the leg stump line and Mahela plays a neat little leg-glance to pick up a boundary. Tuffey shuts his eyes in pain!
around the off stump line, tapped towards short cover, thinks about a single before deciding against it
gets on the front foot and deflects it to the on side
around the off and middle line, pushed back to the bowler
Lovely off drive. It was a length delivery outside off and Silva drove it sweetly to the left of mid-off
fetches this bouncer from outside off and pulls past square-leg. Not quite in control
stays back to punch it to the on side
length delivery tilting into the middle and leg line and Silva runs it down to fine-leg region

run out missed  by Watling. It was pushed towards point and Silva runs across after some hesitation. Watling ran across from backward point and fired the throw at the non-striker's end but missed the stumps. Styris wasn't behind the stumps. he had just back--pedaled but didn't get into position
gets forward to drive for a single
on the middle stump line, the routine occurs: the pad comes first before the bat comes around it
leans forward to defend the length delivery to the off side
Wristy! It was on the middle and he flicked it down to fine-leg region
on the middle stump line, nudged towards midwicket
leans forward to defend towards short covers
Top shot! it was a length delivery outside off stump and Silva moved forward and played the square drive through backward point
shorter in length, steered to backward point where Nathan makes a tumbling stop
on the off stump line, squeezed to Nathan at backward point
back of a length outside off, Mahela leans back and guides it square for one
ooh, tries to paddle from outside off, doesn't get it too far and then Chamara dawdles aimlessly outside the crease thinking of one. Mahela sends him back eventually
goes for the expansive cover drive but it breaks in from outside off and gets the inside edge
similar line, Chamara is more watchful and defends
back to the cross-batted paddle and this time he gets it away towards fine leg
shortens the length to Mahela who stays in the crease and works it off the pads to midwicket
over-pitched on middle and leg, flicked nicely down to midwicket for one more
that's the way you do it! Chamara has had enough of the paddles and goes for a robust little slog sweep and sends McCullum with the spin behind square leg. Powerful blow.
tries to tip and run on the leg side, but it was too close to mid on and midwicket
tries to run this short ball from the backfoot very fine, he was probably too cheeky, ended up missing the fine touch to third man
length ball outside off, played back towards the bowler
sweeping fine again, there is a short fine leg in place and it goes straight to him
Mahela looks to cut outside off and chops it straight to short third
Chamara is putting a lot of effort into tough shots and finding the fielders as well.. This time, reverse swept from leg stump line... straight to short third man
full outside off and driven straight back to the bowler
misses the paddle sweep from outside off this time..
Mahela finally gets one between mid on and midwicket for a single
length ball outside off, Mahela looks to turn it to on side and plays it straight to mid on with soft hands
shorter and wide outside off, Mahela cuts it nicely behind square into the outfield
closer to off stump, Chamara can't get it past point
Oram keeps it back of a length and Chamara is itching to drive and not getting any to. Works it off the backfoot to the leg side, no timing at all
more like it, over-pitched and he punches it well straight down the ground, but there is cover
good finish, another tight ball on a length outside off and Mahela defends to the off side
another reverse sweep.. another instance where Chamara did not connect with a high risk shot.. Hmm
on the pads this time and he goes for the orthodox sweep and gets a single to the deep
flicks the full ball nicely off his toes, square for another single.
Chamara stays back and opens the face outside off to guide it behind square for a couple
stays back, waits for the turn and tucks this towards midwicket for another single
ooh, Mahela nearly flicks that straight into Taylor's hands at short midwicket. Just landed before he caught it, tumbling..
back of a length outside off and played with very soft hands to the leg side.. good running, they were always thinking off two and Chamara made his ground at great pace before the throw came in

interesting from Chamara! Oram was around 3/4th of the way into his delivery stride when Chamara made his intentions clear by trotting down the track.. Oram saw him and droped it short, but he was intent on getting four and went for the pull.. Big top edge flies high and lands safe near fine leg, and through for four
looks to advance again, but the length is tight this time and he plays it back to the bowler

good ball, smart shot and super running! That swung in, Oram was trying to catch him by surprise, Chamara saw it coming and worked it nicely fine and again ran like a high speed train.. Dived it at the striker's end to make his ground this time before Hopkins broke the stumps
shortens the length with this off cutter, Chamara was early into his shot, closing the face early and it bounced safely off the back of his blade to the leg side
whoa, that took off from outside off, did that land on the seam? Chamara was fishing outside off, but this flew well over his angling rod
flighted on middle and off, flicked straight to mid on by Mahela.. Ross Taylor bounces the throw to the keeper hard into the turf.
Mahela walks towards off stump and sweeps with the spin, but there is a fielder at long leg to stop it
big shout for lbw, but that's not even close to out.. Chamara is well outside off as he looks to sweep hard and misses
good ball, pushed through quicker and slightly shorter, Chamara wisely stays back and plays it to leg side
outside off this time, enough room for Chamara to cut it square
Mahela works him with the spin, lots of grace but straight to mid on again
Oram looks for the yorker on off stump, Chamara digs it out but plays straight to cover still gets the single
another yorker attempted, and Mahela can't get under it, he squeezes it down to long on

ah, Chamara will be kicking himself, another full ball, this one sliding down the leg and the batsman got inside the line quickly to work it fine, but could only get some pad on it through to the keeper. Appeal, but there was no bat on that
played away from middle and off line into the covers for a single

exquisite timing from Mahela, if it were any more exquisite he would have found the fielder at deep midwicket! As it transpired, he swung the full toss, effortlessly from leg stump line on the bounce to the fielder
good bouncer to finish a good over, batsman goes for the hook and fails to connect

flighted outside off and Mahela looks to go inside out, not too well timed but enough to elude the infield and run away to the cover fence to reach his fifty.. Not the most fluent of his knocks, but he is finding his form here
super sweep! That was fired in on leg stump, Mahela just redirected it without fuss or violence, just a wave of the magic wand and thre sweep ends at the fine leg fence

smart bowling, McCullum nearly gets him by shortening the length as Mahela advances down the track.. goes through with the pull without reaching the pitch and just gets it over the head of short midwicket
bowled outside off this time, Mahela stays back and cuts it fine
